result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michael J Hineline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The deft shall commit no violation of criminal law to the level of probable cause "probable cause" shall be the level of proof needed to sustain the sufficiency of the criminal complaint of a misd, or that level of proof needed to sustain a bindover for trial if a felony.
If the DCA is not revoked, the charge shall be dismissed with prejudice.
No revocation may take place without a hearing before the Court with notice served upon all parties.
Deft specifically waives her right to a speedy trial, disposition or any applicable statute of limitations to the charge covered by this DCA.
In the event the expiration date of this DCA has passed, nothing in this DCA or the laws of the State of WI shall prevent the State from seeking revocation of this DCA if the State has filed a motion to revoke this DCA prior to the expiration date.
Deft agrees to maintain his/her current address with the Clerk of Courts office.  Any change shall be updated with the Clerk of Courts office within 72 hours of the change.  The defendant further agrees that any court notice mailed to the most recent address he/she has on with the Clerk of Courts office is notice for any further court hearings on this case.
Deft agrees to have no contact directly or indirectly with the victim/s unless specified in family court order.  Child support shall be paid through the State, however, voluntary add'l child support payments can be placed into a bank account with mutual access by both the deft and victim. Deft shall establish this bank account within 60 days of this agreement.
Deft agrees to have an AODA assessments and follow through with recommendations.  Deft to provide the court, at least 30 days prior to the expiration of this agreement, a letter from the counselor.
Deft agrees to complete at least five anger management counseling sessions and to provide proof to the Court at least 30 days prior to expiration of this agreement.
Deft may move outside the State of WI, must comply w/agreement

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
